SENT.plain: Stroke is an uncommon disorder in children but an increasingly recognized cause of disability
Acute stroke may be attributable to trauma, but this topic is seldom discussed
In limited reports, most ischemic strokes following trauma were detected after a considerable delay
Early recognition of stroke following trauma might reduce secondary neurologic complications
We report a case of posterior cerebral artery area infarct following multiple traumas in a child
A comprehensive etiologic survey was undertaken and discussed
Although the definite pathogenesis is still unclear, adequate, individualized, and uncomplicated management can significantly affect the outcome
